noun.description: A dry, rough protective crust that forms over a cut or wound during healing.
Mange or a similar skin disease in animals.
A person or thing regarded with dislike and disgust.

verb.description: Become encrusted or covered with a scab or scabs.
examples: she rested her scabbed fingers on his arm

verb.description: Act or work as a scab.

origin: Middle English (as a noun): from Old Norse skabb; related to dialect shab (compare with shabby). The sense contemptible person (dating from the late 16th century) was probably influenced by Middle Dutch schabbe slut.
